column4: LifeSizeKenDoll: wow, this is a confusing command. does it allow me to specify an editor like nano instead of vim, or does it just allow me to specify a different location for vim?
LifeSizeKenDoll: (i.e., does the replacement program have to be VI-compatible?)
oho! I see... I took a look in the /etc/alternatives directory and it has a bunhc of symlinks... so I use update-alternatives to change the location of those symlinks, eh?
yes.
oooh. In for a treat (and some frustration initially)
you owe yourself to check the debian documentation. There's a policy document, which gives a lot of background info

I like it already. Moved from Gentoo, which I stuck with for so long because of its lovely package manager. But after a hard drive crash, I had to get everything up and running as quickly as possible. So I checked out Ubuntu, because it was all the rave and I wanted something apt-based (it was a toss-up between Fedora and Ubuntu)
I sure like not having to compile my packages ^_^
funny. Sounds like we have the same pattern of usage.
really? are you an ex-Gentooer?
was considering fedora too. Haven't used gentoo for a while...
yes.
cool. So why did you choose Ubuntu over Fedora?
I've used debian on my servers for years.
so it was just more familiar then.
i'm used to the layout, the package tools, the administration model.
in a sense yes.
so here's another question: why did you choose Ubuntu over, say, MEPIS? (I guess the real question here is: do you prefer GNOME over KDE?)
I'm a gnomer, yes. Ever since I grasped the vision of gnome2 and the people dedicated to that project, I was a goner.
guess you could say that the gnome philosophy appeals to me.
yeah, same here... I like the 'Just Works' philosophy (if I had the money, I'd buy a Mac)... I guess I'm sick and tired of thirteen zillion different tools for the job.
lol. I could've said that, verbatim.
